page.title: Apple TV A1469 (3rd generation Rev A)

revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Apple |model=Apple TV |revision=A1469 (3rd generation Rev A) |est_release_date=2013 |fcc_date=01/29/2013 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |type=media streamer |fcc_id=BCGA1469 |ic_id=579C-A1469 |cpu1_brand=Apple |cpu1_model=A5 (S5L8947) |cpu1_cspeed=1 GHz |fla1=8 GiB |fla1_brand=SK hynix |fla1_model=H2JTCG8T22MBR |ram1=512 |ram1_brand=Elpida |ram1_model=B4432BABH-1D-F |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4334 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=abgn |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |eth_chip1_brand=SMSC |eth_chip1_model=LAN8742 |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |flags=Bluetooth 4.0 LE, DFS, HDMI, |802dot11_protocols=abgn }} Per the FCC WiFi test report, the firmware used in the device during testing was '''Rel_6_10_56_189'''. The '''Broadcom''' WL driver used was 6.10 RC56.189. :The FCC Bluetooth test report indicates the device is using BCM4334 (BCM4334B0). "820-3351-04" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. ===Links=== *[https://www.macrumors.com/2013/03/10/tweaked-apple-tv-contains-die-shrunk-a5-chip-not-a5x/ ''Tweaked Apple TV Contains Die-Shrunk A5 Chip, Not A5X'' on '''MacRumors'''] *[https://www.slideshare.net/jjwu6266/apple-ios-device-2013 ''Apple iOS Device 2013'' on '''SlideShare'''] *[http://thenextweb.com/apple/2013/01/30/fcc-filing-teases-new-a5x-powered-smaller-apple-tv-with-iphone-5s-broadcom-wireless-chip/ New, smaller Apple TV 3,2 features A5X processor, iPhone 5â€²s Broadcom BCM4334 chip - '''The Next Web''']
*[http://www.anandtech.com/show/6709/slightly-smaller-apple-tv-32-a1469-contains-a5x-soc-bcm4334-combo Slightly Smaller Apple TV 3,2 (A1469) Contains A5X SoC, BCM4334 Combo - '''Anandtech''']
